mdRecord.dcterms:title: Thoroughgood House, exterior|general view
Adam Thoroughgood House
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: likely built in 1719 by Argall Thorowgood II, great-grandson of Adam Thorowgood. Argall Thorowgood died mid-construction and his wife Susannah completed the work. Their son John later added the elements for which the house is known: its extensive wainscoting and paneling, as well as its dramatic turned staircase. The home is furnished to reflect the period that John Thorowgood and his household occupied the site. -- https://www.museumsvb.org/museums/thoroughgood-house [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
dwellings
chimneys (architectural elements)
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: 1636 Parish Road, Virginia Beach, Virginia, United States
